description:
The primary internal Google customer for Global Logistics Operations (GLO) are Technical Infrastructure (TI) and Global Capacity Delivery (GCD). GLO partners closely with the TI and GCD teams to provide global warehousing, trade compliance, and transportation activities that support the build out of Google’s global compute capacity for Alphabet. GLO manages all logistics support for TI/GCD manufacturing, data center material process, spares support, machine installation, machine decommissioning, reverse logistics, and new product implementation (NPI). GLO also manages all related 3PL activities, physical warehouse management, cross border trade requirements, shipment tracking, multi-year for sites, GLO software, implementation of warehouse automation systems, and ongoing safety and quality program management.

Global Capacity Delivery (GCD) delivers capacity for Alphabet at extraordinary speed, scale and efficiency. We plan, introduce new products, source, build, deliver, and return. We are responsible for Supply Chain Planning, Global Commodity Management, Global Manufacturing, New Product Introduction, Product Lifecycle Management, Global Logistics, Program Management, Supply Chain Responsibility, and Supply Chain BizOps.

GCD plans, buys, builds, and deploys the world's largest cloud infrastructure. We enable our cloud infrastructure to operate in the most resource efficient manner - economically and technically. We provide the world's most sustainable and socially responsible cloud infrastructure.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 20 years of operations management experience, including 3PL supplier management and warehouse automation and MRP systems.
  • Experience managing international teams, suppliers, or projects.
  • Experience leading multi-site or international warehousing, supply chain, or manufacturing operations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or Master’s Degree.
  • Six Sigma, Total Quality Management or other professional certification.
  • Experience with executive-level engagement and large-firm operations consulting.
  • Experience with matrixed strategy implementation in large and complex organizations.
  • Knowledge of state-of-the-art operations and logistics.
  • Metrics-driven approach to identifying, analyzing, and solving problems.
responsibilities:
• Lead global strategies for warehousing, transportation, trade compliance, machine installation, machine decommissioning, reverse logistics, and warehouse automation.
  • Oversee strategic supplier management of an extensive complex global 3PL network across the Americas, EMEA and APAC .
title: Director, Global Logistics Operations
